description:
Dan Smith was seeing this in some nova testing:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/73043/

Looking at logstash, this is showing up a lot since 3/7 which is when lazy translation was enabled in Cinder:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:merged+project:openstack/cinder+branch:master+topic:bug/1280826,n,z

Logstash shows a 99% success rate when this shows up but it can't stay like this, but right now it looks to be more cosmetic than functional.
title: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '_sa_instance_state'

comments.content:
Dan Smith was seeing this in some nova testing:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/73043/

Looking at logstash, this is showing up a lot since 3/7 which is when lazy translation was enabled in Cinder:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#

https://review.openstack.org/#/q/status:merged+project:openstack/cinder+branch:master+topic:bug/1280826,n,z

Logstash shows a 99% success rate when this shows up but it can't stay like this, but right now it looks to be more cosmetic than functional.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: We have tracked this bug back to a problem in gettextutils .  Luis Garcia, Jim Carey and myself have been working on a fix and should have something up early today.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jsbryant

comments.content:
There are a couple of things going on in gettextutils.Message.

(1) The code that handles the deep copy failures only handles TypeError, but that isn't sufficient to handle other deep copy failures.   So the exception handling needs to be broadened

(2) The fix for bug #1288049 (review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/78806) switched from copying each key to copying the whole dictionary, but with the fix, if deep copy fails, the entire dictionary is turned into unicode and can no longer be used for keyword replacement.  
      In particular, when the unicode is passed it treats the unicode as an iterable, takes the first element and sees that it only has one element (it expects a key and value) so it returns: " ValueError: dictionary update sequence element #0 has length 1; 2 is required"
      There are no test cases for the deep copy failure scenario.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jecarey

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/79667
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/79667
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/?id=fd33d1eaa039913d8c82b94c511a3eab0c3d5789
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit fd33d1eaa039913d8c82b94c511a3eab0c3d5789
Author: James Carey <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Mar 11 16:22:12 2014 +0000

    Fix gettextutil.Message handling of deep copy failures
    
    Broadened deep copy exception handling and changed the keyword
    dictionary deep copy to doing each element separately so that only
    the failing dictionary item is converted to unicode.
    
    Also added test cases.
    
    Closes-bug: #1290468
    Change-Id: I15f3880b32bec55bb61d96af41762c98486a274d
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Looks like we also hit this issue in nova. Look into related bug in the Fuel project.

https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1317548
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vkuklin

comments.content:
here is the traceback.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/81339/

Steps to reproduce:

1) deploy openstack with nova-network and some kind of shared storage on compute nodes (in our case it is Ceph)
2) launch a VM
3) associate a floating IP to this instance
4) try to do nova live-migration

Expected result:

instance migrates to the other node and transits to ACTIVE state

Actual result:

instance hangs forever in MIGRATING state


BUT: instance is already on the other node, so it looks like some floating IP migration finalization issue as it migrates seemlessly without floating IP.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vkuklin

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master

It's also in oslo.i18n which nova is using in Juno.
